definition[0]: a system in the US by which people who have Medicaid pay money to a company so that they can receive additional medical care and services that they need
example[0]: My mom has to pay high premiums every month for Medigap to cover prescription drugs.
definition[1]: a type of private medical insurance in the US that covers costs not paid by Medicare
example[1]: Congress has now enacted legislation to standardize Medigap policies.
